meanings.definition: To present or use again in a slightly different form
meanings.sent1: She kept rehashing the same story to her friends.
meanings.sent2: The author was rehashing old ideas in his new book.
meanings.sent3: After rehashing the recipe multiple times, she finally got it right.
meanings.sent4: The artist was rehashing memories onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's rehashing of the lesson made it easier to understand.

meanings.definition: To discuss or go over again
meanings.sent1: They were rehashing the details of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The group kept rehashing the same arguments.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were rehashing their childhood memories with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor was rehashing the day's events for the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The coach's rehashing of the game strategy motivated the team.
